intro: Pedicularis sigmoidea, commonly known as the zigzag lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Europe. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its zigzagging stems and showy, spurred flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, calcareous habitats and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes. Due to its unique morphology and habitat preferences, it is considered a rare and specialized species within its range.
